commit message: initial checkin

added divider line between timer and lap times.  it's a bit of a hack
since the actual one didn't work...
skeleton for countdown in

Change jar ref to be within project rather than absolute filesystem ref,
so that git syncs will work and still build.
actually do the add
Make start/stop button toggle the input mode
Start making input verification
countdown now counts down and plays ringtone / alarm sound at 0.
Add android notification for countdown timer expiration
Mostly fix the countdown stuff.

Adds countdown expiry system notification and tap-to-dismiss (via dirty
hacks)
Fix breaking on rotation in the countdown timer.
Start moving alarm tracking into AlarmService

Extract alarm code into AlarmService.

TODO: start AlarmService on Activity startup instead of just binding,
save and restore the countdown input boxes state
Add save/restore state for the countdown inputs.
More AlarmService changes

Migrated AlarmService to use AlarmManager... code is almost working, but
still need an AlarmService to manage playback of the alarm sound itself,
so that it will be cancellable - BroadcastReceivers have too short a
lifespan.

Reinstate AlarmService, but this time a non multithreaded version which
uses Intents for inter-object communication - much less messy
conceptually.  Also, change the stopwatch ui thread to target 60fps
updates rather than just doing Thread.yield().

Switch to using NumberPicker for inputs, and fix cancelling the
countdown making the alarm no longer ring.
Delete dead code since we are now in a different branch

Finally make an xml for the text countdown timer instead of making it
programatically.

disable keyboard input for the numberpickers since it's horribly fucked
up as far as focused element goes :(
remove unnecessary line

testing performance... really need to figure out how to load via
bluetooth or some such :/
widen button
clean up crash on screen rotate

Initial add of the world clock.  Currently doesn't have a way for you to
choose the timezone... also needs a subtext saying the timezone of each
clock.  Required hacking the digitalclock and reimplementing the
analogclock.
switch to use ListView, and fix background on add button
tried filtering the timezones in the selection dialog

add edit/remove interface for existing clocks, synchronize updates
between analog and digital clocks, add textview saying which timezone is
which

annotate timezone offsets and sort dialog list.  should still try to
curate the list to be shorter...
fix incorrect timezone setting

change the timezone input dialog into something that's actually usable
instead of a giant list.  now it's a slider and a giant list.  lol.
change the pressable linearlayout into an actual button
hack to get the bottom divider to be the same as the listview one
use same divider trick to replace fake divider in stopwatch
start switching lap times to listview

add workaround to scrolling issue.  scroll to bottom now works, although
a bit bouncy.
workaround for broken listview
enable debug mode to debug on physical device
fallback hack since the scroll still doesn't reliably work...

pretty much revert all of the listview stuff for the lap times, since it
just wasn't working.  extract the scrollview veresion into LapTimes
class, add additional logic to save/restore scroll position even on
layout change.
fix crash on double rotate while paused in stopwatch.
make rotating work for world clock.
remove dead code for the old LinearLayout button background.

quite a major refactoring of stopwatchfragment.  also cleaned up its id
names.  now no longer explicitly deals with threads.
not sure if the binary changes were pushed right

this works for now... should really make the countdown finished dialog
part of the activity probably, which would mean notifying via the
service instead of using the timer.  in which case, might as well make
the timer more like TimerTextView and have it update on draw, if that
will work.

change analog clock update code to use same timing method as
DigitalClock.

countdown changes: dialog now part of Activity instead, so it will show
up independent of the selected tab; change to use CountdownTextView
instead of a separate thread.  Still need to remove dead thread code.
cleanup old thread code.

fix rotate bug in countdowntimer which didn't correctly save state (it's
saved twice, but now it saves the same state both times.)
Deprecate DanWidgets, add icons

Fix bug where cancelling an active countdown after rotating toggled
input mode but didn't cancel the scheduled alarm event.

Preserve world clock list across app restarts, and make world clock the
default tab.  Also, change displayed time zone name to human-friendly
version.  Should also dedupe and display these in the selector dialog.

State save/restore from cold restart for stopwatch fragment.

Random thought: would be better to do continuous save for the instance
vars which don't change a lot - might want to consider wrapping them in
an object, i.e. BooleanPreference, and then have a boolean getValue()
and void setValue(boolean value).
add 1px line divider between tab pages
begin work to move countdown to use sharedprefs

patch up toggleinputmode on timer finish... might need a bit more to
handle corner cases
SavedPrefs for Countdown working
fix a state restoring bug in Countdown fragment
code cleanup
(hopefully) make selected tab state persist across app restarts.

Make timezone select dialog use human readable names and deduplicate
using these, and make world clock time text white instead of grey.
pass 2 on the logo.  may want to get rid of the dropshadow still.
reduced drop shadow amount a bit in the icon
Refactor and remove various dead code
Rip out all the savedInstanceState code from StopwatchFragment

Rip out savedInstanceState from Countdown.  Bug appeared but could not
reproduce...

Fix how TimerActivity gets CountdownFragment to re-enable input mode on
timer finish.

Split toggleInputMode into inputMode{On,Off}, since TimerActivity only
ever wants to turn it on.  Should help solve corner cases.

Start to speed up numberpicker so the render speed isn't crazy slow.
Some strange differences from the native version came up...
get numberpicker working, mostly
maybe more reliable way of getting the attrarray

fix missing numberpicker indices, and improve longpress behavior - still
has a bug on longpress decrement

fix missing last number on scroll down, and fix mis-format of countdown
hour text for hour > 60.

fixed the numberpicker scroll not being reset when you swipe across
fragments by first selecting a numberpicker.  also disabled the thing
where they initially show up as selected and then fade out, because it
activates more than once (the intended behavior) when re-initialized as
part of a fragment.
much less messy bitmap caching - just caches the entire scrollwheel.
fix black box on clear

fix why the new caching i was doing didn't work on the actual phone.
the cached bitmaps were larger than the max texture size.  now they
aren't, they're just segmented into the largest possible segments.

the remaining slowness in the numberpickers seems to be due to fading
edge.  add another caching layer that will allow for us to cache the
fading edge effect.  just need to copy the implementation from View.

copy over implementation of fading edge from view.  also fix the
numberpicker not honoring the height measure spec, it now works when
rotated.
keep item separation constant on rotate.

fix the last number in each cached pane having anything rendered below
the baseline cut off.  wish there were a nicer way to do this...

fix the top element disappearing when scrolling up sometimes. should
really rework the whole scroll offset system now that the caching just
needs the offset of the first element.

mess around with the viewpager to keep things cached so scrolling is
faster.  not finished yet - the initial loading stuff doesn't restore
state correctly...

fix restoration of last selected tab.  doesn't help with preloading
though...

figured out how to force a pre-render, by rendering to an offscreen
bitmap at the end of onCreateView.

change the scroll offset calculation code to be absolute offset based
rather than also maintaining an array of indices.  this way makes way
more sense given the rendering code changes.

fix broken scroll offset for numberpickers on rotate.  needed to redraw
cached tiles on changed selector element height.
fix overscroll on long press of the increment/decrement buttons

fix for rotate messing up displayed text.  weird that it was
happening... maybe there's a better fix.  also changed the longpress
scroller finish behavior - it now just stops and lets the adjust
scroller finish the scroll.

remove excess logging from FasterNumberPicker, and synchronize
AnalogClockWithTimezone's tick to the actual second bound rather than
uptime mod 1000 = 0.

partially working on older devices.  most likely broke a lot of stuff on
ICS to get stuff to work, so making this a separate branch.  will try to
slowly work around the broken stuff.  the worst offender is (of course)
the countdown view with the numberpicker.... ugh.

fix world clock - arrayadapter doesn't support addAll in earlier
versions
start adding linearlayout compat class
finished linearlayout compat class.  seems to work fine
start creating compat numberpicker
copy in a ton of numberpicker stuff from sdk for compat

add more ids to compat.R.  i have no clue why it's trying to commit so
many files :/

we're almost working!  need to fix numberpicker having the wrong min/max
on paint and the first offset being wrong (probably the same problem).

fixed both previous bugs.  far right edittext is 1px off though still,
idk why.

'fix' the excessive edittext padding by making it invisible when in
compat mode and manually drawing the part that should show up, in a
cached way.

start switching the caching strategy for the numberpicker so that we
don't have to cache everything, since memory pressure was a big issue.
fixed bug in new caching method causing tiles to be glitched
get us working again on ICS
get numberpicker dividers working again in ICS.

start putting the animators back in.  i think they'll perform fine with
the new second-level caching.

finish putting the animators back in.  also fix max fling too low on
older versions.  remove some debug logging no longer needed.
fix not realigning numberpicker scroll offset on a slow and slight move
fix bad initial bump offset due to change in caching
persist dismiss dialog state, and do cleanup of it properly.
fix numberpicker not rendering for a bit after load
fix long fade wait on initial touch in numberpicker

save numberpicker value changes instantly instead of waiting for
destroy.

change the stream type of the countdown alarm from music to alarm, so it
will play back at the volume level set for alarms rather than music.
start code cleanup
more cleaning up, added a backwards-compatible Space clone
start adding alarm sound picker in countdown
get the alarm sound selector working
get numberpicker to work with the more cramped space now
try a different sideways layout for countdown
new stopwatch landscape layout

fix broken saved scroll position.  note that saved data for the app must
be cleared when switching to this revision.
working on honeycomb (galaxy tab 10.1)

successfully canonize default ringtone uri.  should either remove hard
paths or save them in prefs.
fix broken ICS compatability
extract alarm selection into separate class
add caching and cache reloading
save filesystem path instead of content uri

got working again on 2.1.  lost the divider on add button in world clock
though...
fix missing divider in world clock add button.
updated logo

use sinc scaling in gimp instead of exporting directly to output size
from inkscape
compile the binaries with new logo
updated icon
remove dependence on middle item index

size textgap relative to text size rather than aiming for a specific
fixed number of visible texts
remove unnecessary compat logic
something weird happened
rebuild the apk

FasterNumberPicker: complete the previous scroll on downward
touch regardless of whether or not the inc/dec buttons are visible
scale down lap times if they would have wrapped
Get world clock view to work correctly with larger font setting.
clean up some unused imports

seems to be a more reliable way of resizing the texts when they get too
big

add checks to keep from possibility of starting a new countdown while
alarm for the old one starts ringing

fix the pst showing as -2 of est issue by using a different form of
timezone name which includes dst.

delay prerender of other tabs, to speed up rotation.  also, force
invalidation of timer text - not sure if this is the issue, but the
symptom is a non-changing timer text view.

enable compatibility mode for jellybean since it breaks the numberpicker
with stock resource ids
remove log calls and imports
add copyright notices
update manifest

renamed NFC to AutoStart

Merge pull request #3 from danielschudel/release_1.2-NFC

Release 1.2 nfc

fixes:
- compile error due to bad parent in styles.xml
- avoid reading from SD card if we get SecurityException while
finding ringtones.  instead, current workaround is to read only from
the system alarms directory.  SDcard-based ringtones should work via
the system default alarm sound, which can be changed in system
settings.
bump up version number for KK fixes
add larger icons for higher res/dpi displays.
recompiled
changes to make exporting an APK work, don't know why it was failing
add default ringtone to list, for backwards compat

hopefully final? changes to support upgrade seamlessly.  was using the
array adapter incorrectly before actually, so this will probably also
fix bugs associated with that
switch debug back to false
made final 1.3 apk
Added .gitignore to the project.

Extracted visible strings/texts to prepare the application for
localisation.
Extended .gitignore.
Untrack .classpath and .project.
Added localization for German.
